meanings.definition: Showing a fear or dislike of anything new or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The neophobic cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent2: She is neophobic when it comes to trying out different restaurants.
meanings.sent3: The neophobic puppy barked at the unfamiliar toy.
meanings.sent4: His neophobic tendencies kept him from exploring new hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The neophobic child clung to their old toys, avoiding the new ones.

meanings.definition: A person who is resistant to change or new experiences.
meanings.sent1: The neophobic in the group always resists any changes to the routine.
meanings.sent2: As a neophobic, he struggled to adapt to the new technology.
meanings.sent3: The neophobic at work refused to attend the team-building activities.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a neophobic in a world that was constantly evolving.
meanings.sent5: The neophobic's discomfort with change was evident in their reactions.
